metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39636 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In do_ipt_get_ctl and do_ipt_set_ctl of ip_tables.c, there is a possible way to leak kernel information due to uninitialized data. This could lead to local information disclosure with system execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-120612905References: Upstream kernel It was discovered that the network packet filtering implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly initialize information in certain circumstances. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-lowlatency - 4.4.0-223.256
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-aws - 4.4.0-1139.153
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-223.256').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.153').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
